benchmark_details.name: CodecBench (Comprehensive Benchmark for Acoustic and Semantic Evaluation)
benchmark_details.overview: CodecBench is a comprehensive evaluation framework designed to assess audio codec performance from both acoustic and semantic perspectives across diverse scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To bridge the evaluation gap and foster advancements in audio codec development for multimodal applications.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: CodecBench still falls short in addressing certain extreme scenarios encountered in real-world applications.

data.source: Contains 18 open-source datasets and 1 self-collected dataset, including various audio categories.
data.format: Various formats depending on the dataset

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on acoustic fidelity and semantic alignment through specifically designed tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER indicates better semantic alignment; lower Mel Loss indicates better perceptual quality.
methodology.baseline_results: Comparison results provided against previous benchmarks like Codec-SUPERB.
methodology.validation: Evaluation based on a comprehensive set of diverse scenarios reflecting real-world applications.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Various licenses depending on the dataset used.
